title: state-schooldata
text: NEVER use Urban Institute API, NCES CCD, federal data source — entire point packages provide STATE-LEVEL data directly state . Federal sources aggregate/transform data differently lose state-specific details. state DOE source broken, FIX find alternative STATE source — fall back federal data.

title: state-schooldata
text: NEVER reference Claude, Claude Code, AI assistance commit messages NEVER reference Claude, Claude Code, AI assistance PR descriptions NEVER add Co-Authored-lines mentioning Claude Anthropic Keep commit messages focused changed, written

title: state-schooldata
text: NEVER push directly main. changes must go PRs auto-merge:
code: # 1. Create feature branch git checkout -b fix/description-of-change  # 2. Make changes, commit git add -A git commit -m "Fix: description of change"  # 3. Push and create PR with auto-merge git push -u origin fix/description-of-change gh pr create --title "Fix: description" --body "Description of changes" gh pr merge --auto --squash  # 4. Clean up stale branches after PR merges git checkout main && git pull && git fetch --prune origin

title: state-schooldata
text: Clean stale branches every time touch package:
code: # Delete local branches merged to main git branch --merged main | grep -v main | xargs -r git branch -d  # Prune remote tracking branches git fetch --prune origin

title: state-schooldata
text: PRs auto-merge CI checks pass: - R-CMD-check (0 errors, 0 warnings) - Python tests (py{st}schooldata exists) - pkgdown build (vignettes must render) CI fails, fix issue push - auto-merge triggers checks pass.

title: state-schooldata
text: PRs merged CI passes. Run checks locally opening PR:

title: state-schooldata
code: # R package check (required) devtools::check()  # Python tests (required) system("pip install -e ./py{st}schooldata && pytest tests/test_py{st}schooldata.py -v")  # pkgdown build (required) pkgdown::build_site()

title: state-schooldata
text: opening PR, verify: - [ ] devtools::check() — 0 errors, 0 warnings - [ ] pytest tests/test_py{st}schooldata.py — tests pass - [ ] pkgdown::build_site() — builds without errors - [ ] Vignettes render (eval=FALSE hacks)

title: state-schooldata
text: package includes tests/testthat/test-pipeline-live.R LIVE network tests.

title: state-schooldata
text: URL Availability - HTTP 200 checks File Download - Verify actual file (HTML error) File Parsing - readxl/readr succeeds Column Structure - Expected columns exist get_raw_enr() - Raw data function works Data Quality - Inf/NaN, non-negative counts Aggregation - State total > 0 Output Fidelity - tidy=TRUE matches raw

title: state-schooldata
code: devtools::test(filter = "pipeline-live")

title: state-schooldata
text: tidy=TRUE MUST maintain fidelity raw, unprocessed data: - Enrollment counts tidy format must exactly match wide format - rounding transformation counts tidying - Percentages calculated fresh counts preserved - State aggregates sums school-level data

title: state-schooldata
text: NEVER use man/figures/ generate_readme_figs.R README images. README images MUST come pkgdown-generated vignette output auto-update merge: : Vignette figures regenerate automatically pkgdown builds. Manual man/figures/ requires running separate script easy forget, causing stale/broken images.
code: ![Chart name](https://almartin82.github.io/{package}/articles/{vignette}_files/figure-html/{chunk-name}-1.png)

what: README Must Be Identical to Vignette
title: state-schooldata
text: CRITICAL RULE: README content MUST identical vignette - code blocks, outputs, narrative text must match exactly. ensures: - Code verified run - Outputs real (fabricated) - Images auto-generated pkgdown - Single source truth

title: state-schooldata
text: Every README MUST least 15 stories/sections README pkgdown front page. story tells data story headline, narrative, code, output, visualization.

title: state-schooldata
text: Every story/section README MUST follow structure: Headline: compelling, factual statement data Narrative text: Brief explanation matters Code: R code fetches analyzes data (MUST exist vignette) Output code: Data table/print statement showing actual values (REQUIRED) Visualization: Chart vignette (auto-generated pkgdown)

title: state-schooldata
text: Claude MUST read verify story: - Headline must make sense supported code code output - Headline must directly contradicted Claude’s world knowledge - headline dubious unsupported, flag fix - Year ranges headlines must match actual data availability

title: state-schooldata
text: README grab attention compelling: - Headlines surprising, newsworthy, counterintuitive - Lead interesting findings - Tell stories make people want explore data - Avoid boring/generic statements like “enrollment changed time”

title: state-schooldata
text: Every visualization MUST actual data : - Empty charts = something broken (data issue, bad filter, wrong column) - Verify charts visually show meaningful data - chart empty, investigate fix underlying problem

title: state-schooldata
text: links README must valid: - 404s - broken image URLs - dead vignette references - Test links committing

title: state-schooldata
text: README start : - Project motivation/package exists - Link back njschooldata mothership (original package) - Brief overview data available (years, entities, subgroups) - hook makes readers want explore

title: state-schooldata
text: README include Data Notes section covering: - Data source (state DOE URL) - Available years - Suppression rules (e.g., counts <10 suppressed) - known data quality issues caveats - Census Day reporting period details

title: state-schooldata
text: README must 4 badges order: 1. R CMD CHECK 2. Python tests 3. pkgdown 4. lifecycle

title: state-schooldata
text: README must include quickstart code languages: - R installation basic fetch example - Python installation basic fetch example - show data consistency

title: state-schooldata
text: Idaho fix revealed critical bugs README code didn’t match vignettes: - Wrong district names (lowercase vs CAPS) - Text claims contradicted actual data - Missing data output examples

title: state-schooldata
text: state-deploy skill verifies deployment: - Extracts README code blocks - Searches vignettes EXACT matches - Fails deployment code found vignettes - Randomly audits packages claim accuracy

title: state-schooldata
text: ❌ Wrong district/entity names (case sensitivity, typos) ❌ Text claims contradict data ❌ Broken code fails silently ❌ Missing data output ❌ Empty charts data ❌ Broken image links ✅ Verified, accurate, reproducible examples

title: state-schooldata
text: 3. Commit cache directories: - Cache directories (vignettes/*_cache/) committed git - add *_cache/ .gitignore - Cache provides reproducible builds faster CI
code: ### 1. State enrollment grew 28% since 2002  State added 68,000 students from 2002 to 2026, bucking national trends.  ```r library(arschooldata) library(dplyr)  enr <- fetch_enr_multi(2002:2026)  enr %>%   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   select(end_year, n_students) %>%   filter(end_year %in% c(2002, 2026)) %>%   mutate(change = n_students - lag(n_students),          pct_change = round((n_students / lag(n_students) - 1) * 100, 1)) # Prints: 2002=XXX, 2026=YYY, change=ZZZ, pct=PP.P% ---  ## Vignette Caching (REQUIRED)  All packages use knitr chunk caching to speed up vignette builds and CI.  ### Three-Part Caching Approach  **1. Enable knitr caching in setup chunks:** ```r ```{r setup, include=FALSE} knitr::opts_chunk$set(   echo = TRUE,   message = FALSE,   warning = FALSE,   cache = TRUE ) **2. Use cache in fetch calls:** ```r enr <- fetch_enr(2024, use_cache = TRUE) enr_multi <- fetch_enr_multi(2020:2024, use_cache = TRUE)

title: state-schooldata
text: Reproducibility: cache = output across builds CI Speed: Cache hits avoid expensive data downloads Consistency: developers get identical vignette results Stability: Network issues don’t break vignette builds

title: state-schooldata
text: package clear_cache() cache_status() functions: Cache stored two locations: 1. Vignette cache: vignettes/*_cache/ (committed git) 2. Data cache: rappdirs::user_cache_dir() (local , committed)
code: # View cached files cache_status()  # Clear all cache clear_cache()  # Clear specific year clear_cache(2024)

code: ```{r session-info} sessionInfo()

title: Minnesota School Data Expansion Research
text: Last Updated: 2026-01-04 Theme Researched: Graduation Rates

title: Minnesota School Data Expansion Research
text: Minnesota graduation rate data available Minnesota Department Education (MDE). data accessible MDEAnalytics portal Minnesota Report Card, use WebFOCUS reporting infrastructure. Unlike enrollment data direct file downloads, graduation data appears primarily accessed interactive reporting tools generate exports demand. Key Finding: graduation data download mechanism uses WebFOCUS servlets (ibi_apps) rather direct file URLs, making programmatic access complex enrollment data. Minnesota Report Card also provides graduation data expose public API.

title: Minnesota School Data Expansion Research
text: R-CMD-check: PASSING Python tests: PASSING pkgdown: PASSING Current Data Types: Enrollment (2007-2024) Data Source Pattern: MDEAnalytics portal CGI fallback

what: Source 1: MDEAnalytics Data Reports - Graduation Rate Topic
title: Minnesota School Data Expansion Research
text: URL: https://pub.education.mn.gov/MDEAnalytics/DataTopic.jsp?TOPICID=242 HTTP Status: 200 (page loads, content iframe) Format: Interactive reporting interface Excel/Tab export Years: 2003-2024 (adjusted cohort rates calculated back 2003) Access Method: WebFOCUS servlet (ibi_apps), requires browser interaction servlet mimicking Update Frequency: Annual, released February/March Technical Details: - Page uses iframe: src="/ibi_apps/WFServlet?IBIF_ex=mdea_ddl_topic_select_PAGELAUNCH&TOPICID=242" - Export functions: flexDownload() flexPrint() JavaScript functions - Requires JavaScript execution access file list

title: Minnesota School Data Expansion Research
text: URL: https://rc.education.mn.gov/#graduation/ Example: https://rc.education.mn.gov/#graduation/orgId--999999000000__groupType--state__year--2024__graduationYearRate--4__p--1 HTTP Status: 200 Format: Interactive Backbone.js application Years: 2012-2024 (adjusted cohort methodology started 2012) Access Method: JavaScript application, public API Export Options: PDF export (per interface documentation) Technical Details: - Uses Backbone.js, RequireJS, Highcharts - Data loaded dynamically via JavaScript - documented JSON API programmatic access - Contact: mde.analytics@state.mn.us

what: Source 3: Graduation Indicators Files (via Data Center)
title: Minnesota School Data Expansion Research
text: URL: Navigation path: MDE Homepage > Data Center > Data Reports Analytics > Student Data > Category: Graduation Rate HTTP Status: Unknown (requires interactive navigation) Format: Excel (.xlsx) Tab-delimited (.tab) Years: 2003-2024 Access Method: Interactive file selection download Graduation Indicators (rates cohort) Graduation Counts (student counts graduation year)

title: Minnesota School Data Expansion Research
text: URL: https://education.mn.gov/mdeprod/idcplg?IdcService=GET_FILE&dDocName=005342&RevisionSelectionMethod=latestReleased&Rendition=primary Notes: Documents file structure column definitions assessment files; similar patterns likely apply graduation files

title: Minnesota School Data Expansion Research
text: Minnesota uses federally-required Adjusted Cohort Graduation Rate (ACGR): - Students assigned cohort entering 9th grade - Example: 9th graders Fall 2020 = 2024 four-year cohort - Cohorts adjusted transfers /- Rates recalculated back 2003 using methodology

code: https://pub.education.mn.gov/MDEAnalytics/DataDownload.do POST parameters: - category = "Enrollment" - year = end_year - level = "School" | "District" | "State" - format = "xlsx" POST parameters: - category = "Graduation Rate" or "Graduation" - year = end_year - level = "School" | "District" | "State" - format = "xlsx"

title: Minnesota School Data Expansion Research
text: Graduation rates core educational metric High user demand cohort analysis Complements existing enrollment data

title: Minnesota School Data Expansion Research
text: Challenges: 1. direct file download URLs discovered 2. Data accessed WebFOCUS servlet requiring session management 3. May need mimic browser interaction use POST requests 4. Multiple rate types (4yr, 5yr, 6yr, 7yr) different files 5. Student group breakdowns add complexity

title: Minnesota School Data Expansion Research
text: Analyze existing enrollment CGI code download_mde_via_cgi() Modify POST parameters graduation category Test different year/level combinations Handle different file structures indicators vs counts
code: download_mde_graduation <- function(end_year, level = "school", type = "indicators") {   cgi_url <- "https://pub.education.mn.gov/MDEAnalytics/DataDownload.do"    post_params <- list(     category = "Graduation Rate",     year = as.character(end_year),     level = switch(level, "school" = "School", "district" = "District", "state" = "State"),     format = "xlsx",     type = type  # "indicators" or "counts"   )    # ... similar to enrollment CGI code }

text: POST doesn’t work, potentially: 1. Use RSelenium chromote browser automation 2. Navigate Report Card interface programmatically 3. Export PDF parse (ideal)

title: Minnesota School Data Expansion Research
text: Email mde.analytics@state.mn.us API access Request bulk data file location May provide alternative access method

title: Minnesota School Data Expansion Research
text: Based publicly reported values:
code: test_that("2024: State 4-year rate matches public data", {   skip_if_offline()   data <- fetch_grad(2024, tidy = TRUE)   state_4yr <- data |>     filter(is_state, grad_type == "4-year", subgroup == "all_students") |>     pull(rate)   expect_equal(state_4yr, 84.2, tolerance = 0.1) })  test_that("2024: Total 4-year graduates matches public data", {   skip_if_offline()   data <- fetch_grad(2024, tidy = FALSE)   total_grads <- sum(data$graduate_count_4yr[data$level == "State"], na.rm = TRUE)   expect_equal(total_grads, 59720, tolerance = 100) })  test_that("2023: State 4-year rate matches public data", {   skip_if_offline()   data <- fetch_grad(2023, tidy = TRUE)   state_4yr <- data |>     filter(is_state, grad_type == "4-year", subgroup == "all_students") |>     pull(rate)   expect_equal(state_4yr, 83.3, tolerance = 0.1) })

title: Minnesota School Data Expansion Research
code: test_that("Graduation rates are valid percentages", {   data <- fetch_grad(2024, tidy = TRUE)   expect_true(all(data$rate >= 0, na.rm = TRUE))   expect_true(all(data$rate <= 100, na.rm = TRUE)) })  test_that("7-year rate >= 4-year rate for same cohort", {   data <- fetch_grad(2024, tidy = FALSE)   expect_true(all(data$rate_7yr >= data$rate_4yr, na.rm = TRUE)) })  test_that("Major districts exist in all years", {   major_districts <- c("0001", "0625", "0011")  # Minneapolis, St Paul, Anoka-Hennepin (IDs TBD)   for (yr in 2020:2024) {     data <- fetch_grad(yr, tidy = FALSE)     expect_true(all(major_districts %in% data$district_id))   } })

Workaround options: 1. Run pkgdown build network available 2. Use GitHub Actions pkgdown builds (recommended - already configured .github/) Note: package vignettes directory, reference documentation generated.

what: 1. Minneapolis and St. Paul are shrinking
title: Minnesota Enrollment Trends
text: Twin Cities’ two largest urban districts lost 10,000 students past decade, driven declining birth rates, rising housing costs, competition charters suburbs.
code: tc <- enr %>%   filter(is_district, grepl("Minneapolis|St. Paul", district_name, ignore.case = TRUE),          subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL")  ggplot(tc, aes(x = end_year, y = n_students, color = district_name)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1.2) +   geom_point(size = 2.5) +   scale_y_continuous(labels = comma) +   labs(title = "Minneapolis and St. Paul Are Shrinking",        subtitle = "Each lost over 10,000 students in the past decade",        x = "School Year", y = "Students", color = "") +   theme_readme()

title: Minnesota Enrollment Trends
text: Minneapolis one largest Somali populations United States, fundamentally changing city’s schools two decades. Black students now make approximately 35% Minneapolis enrollment.
code: mpls <- enr %>%   filter(is_district, grepl("Minneapolis", district_name, ignore.case = TRUE),          !grepl("Special", district_name),          grade_level == "TOTAL",          subgroup %in% c("white", "black", "hispanic", "asian"))  ggplot(mpls, aes(x = end_year, y = pct * 100, color = subgroup)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1.2) +   geom_point(size = 2.5) +   scale_color_manual(values = colors,                      labels = c("Asian", "Black", "Hispanic", "White")) +   labs(title = "Minneapolis Demographics Transformation",        subtitle = "Black students (including large Somali population) approach 35%",        x = "School Year", y = "Percent", color = "") +   theme_readme()

title: Minnesota Enrollment Trends
text: Minnesota invented charter schools 1991 - first state . Today, 180 charter schools serve nearly 7% state’s students. Charter enrollment grown steadily traditional district enrollment declined.
code: # Charter schools in Minnesota have district IDs starting with "07" charter <- enr %>%   filter(is_district, grepl("^07", district_id),          subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   group_by(end_year) %>%   summarize(n_students = sum(n_students, na.rm = TRUE),             n_charters = n_distinct(district_id),             .groups = "drop")  ggplot(charter, aes(x = end_year, y = n_students)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1.5, color = colors["total"]) +   geom_point(size = 3, color = colors["total"]) +   scale_y_continuous(labels = comma) +   labs(title = "Minnesota Invented Charter Schools",        subtitle = "Over 60,000 students in 180+ charters - nation's first charter law (1991)",        x = "School Year", y = "Students") +   theme_readme()

title: Minnesota Enrollment Trends
text: Minneapolis St. Paul shrink, suburban ring continues grow. Districts like Anoka-Hennepin (state’s largest), Lakeville, Rosemount-Apple Valley-Eagan absorbed families leaving urban core.
code: suburban <- enr %>%   filter(is_district,          grepl("Anoka-Hennepin|Lakeville|Rosemount|Prior Lake", district_name, ignore.case = TRUE),          subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL")  ggplot(suburban, aes(x = end_year, y = n_students, color = district_name)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1.2) +   geom_point(size = 2.5) +   scale_y_continuous(labels = comma) +   labs(title = "Suburban Ring is Booming",        subtitle = "Metro suburbs growing while core cities shrink",        x = "School Year", y = "Students", color = "") +   theme_readme()

title: Minnesota Enrollment Trends
text: 85% white 2007 70% today, Minnesota experiencing one fastest demographic shifts Midwest. Hispanic Asian populations growing rapidly, white student share declines.
code: demo <- enr %>%   filter(is_state, grade_level == "TOTAL",          subgroup %in% c("white", "black", "hispanic", "asian"))  ggplot(demo, aes(x = end_year, y = pct * 100, color = subgroup)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1.2) +   geom_point(size = 2.5) +   scale_color_manual(values = colors,                      labels = c("Asian", "Black", "Hispanic", "White")) +   labs(title = "Minnesota Diversifying Fast",        subtitle = "From 85% white in 2007 to under 70% today",        x = "School Year", y = "Percent", color = "") +   theme_readme()

title: Minnesota Enrollment Trends
text: pandemic caused 8% drop Minnesota kindergarten enrollment 2021 - nearly 5,000 fewer children. “COVID cohort” smaller surrounding grades moves system.
code: k_trend <- enr %>%   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment",          grade_level %in% c("K", "01", "06", "12")) %>%   mutate(grade_label = case_when(     grade_level == "K" ~ "Kindergarten",     grade_level == "01" ~ "Grade 1",     grade_level == "06" ~ "Grade 6",     grade_level == "12" ~ "Grade 12"   ))  ggplot(k_trend, aes(x = end_year, y = n_students, color = grade_label)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1.2) +   geom_point(size = 2.5) +   geom_vline(xintercept = 2021, linetype = "dashed", color = "red", alpha = 0.5) +   scale_y_continuous(labels = comma) +   labs(title = "COVID Hit Minnesota Kindergarten Hard",        subtitle = "Lost 8% - nearly 5,000 fewer kids in 2021",        x = "School Year", y = "Students", color = "") +   theme_readme()

title: Minnesota Enrollment Trends
text: Minnesota’s Iron Range - mining region northeast - continues decades-long population decline. Districts like Hibbing, Virginia, Eveleth-Gilbert lost students mining employment decreases young families move away.
code: iron_range <- enr %>%   filter(is_district,          grepl("Hibbing|Virginia|Eveleth|Chisholm|Mountain Iron", district_name, ignore.case = TRUE),          subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   group_by(end_year) %>%   summarize(n_students = sum(n_students, na.rm = TRUE), .groups = "drop")  ggplot(iron_range, aes(x = end_year, y = n_students)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1.5, color = colors["total"]) +   geom_point(size = 3, color = colors["total"]) +   scale_y_continuous(labels = comma) +   labs(title = "Iron Range Still Declining",        subtitle = "Combined enrollment for Hibbing, Virginia, Eveleth, Chisholm, Mountain Iron",        x = "School Year", y = "Students") +   theme_readme()

title: Minnesota Enrollment Trends
text: Driven Mayo Clinic $5 billion expansion (Destination Medical Center), Rochester one outstate cities gaining students. district added 2,000 students past decade.
code: rochester <- enr %>%   filter(is_district, grepl("Rochester", district_name, ignore.case = TRUE),          subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL")  ggplot(rochester, aes(x = end_year, y = n_students)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1.5, color = colors["total"]) +   geom_point(size = 3, color = colors["total"]) +   scale_y_continuous(labels = comma, limits = c(0, NA)) +   labs(title = "Rochester: A Growing City",        subtitle = "Mayo Clinic expansion driving school enrollment growth",        x = "School Year", y = "Students") +   theme_readme()

title: Minnesota Enrollment Trends
text: 80,000 Minnesota students English learners, concentrated heavily Twin Cities metro. Minneapolis, St. Paul, suburban districts like Brooklyn Center Richfield EL populations exceeding 30%.
code: el <- enr_current %>%   filter(is_district, subgroup == "lep", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   arrange(desc(n_students)) %>%   head(10) %>%   mutate(district_label = reorder(district_name, n_students))  ggplot(el, aes(x = district_label, y = n_students)) +   geom_col(fill = colors["total"]) +   coord_flip() +   scale_y_continuous(labels = comma) +   labs(title = "English Learners Concentrated in Metro",        subtitle = "Top 10 districts by number of EL students",        x = "", y = "English Learner Students") +   theme_readme()

title: Minnesota Enrollment Trends
text: Minnesota’s economic inequality stark: 5% free/reduced lunch wealthy districts like Edina Minnetonka 70% urban rural districts. gap widened past decade.
code: econ <- enr_current %>%   filter(is_district, subgroup == "econ_disadv", grade_level == "TOTAL",          n_students > 500) %>%   arrange(desc(pct)) %>%   head(10) %>%   mutate(district_label = reorder(district_name, pct))  ggplot(econ, aes(x = district_label, y = pct * 100)) +   geom_col(fill = colors["total"]) +   coord_flip() +   labs(title = "Free/Reduced Lunch Shows Economic Divide",        subtitle = "Top 10 districts by percent economically disadvantaged",        x = "", y = "Percent Economically Disadvantaged") +   theme_readme()

what: 11. Duluth: Slow decline in the Northland
title: Minnesota Enrollment Trends
text: Minnesota’s fourth-largest city seen steady enrollment decline regional economy struggled. Duluth school district closed several schools faces ongoing budget pressures.
code: duluth <- enr %>%   filter(is_district, grepl("Duluth", district_name, ignore.case = TRUE),          subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL")  ggplot(duluth, aes(x = end_year, y = n_students)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1.5, color = colors["total"]) +   geom_point(size = 3, color = colors["total"]) +   scale_y_continuous(labels = comma, limits = c(0, NA)) +   labs(title = "Duluth: Slow Decline in the Northland",        subtitle = "Minnesota's fourth-largest city faces ongoing enrollment pressure",        x = "School Year", y = "Students") +   theme_readme()

what: 12. Native American students: concentrated in specific regions
title: Minnesota Enrollment Trends
text: Minnesota significant Native American student populations, concentrated districts near reservations including Red Lake, Cass Lake-Bena, Fond du Lac. districts often face unique funding resource challenges.
code: native <- enr_current %>%   filter(is_district, subgroup == "native_american", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   arrange(desc(pct)) %>%   filter(n_students >= 50) %>%   head(10) %>%   mutate(district_label = reorder(district_name, pct))  ggplot(native, aes(x = district_label, y = pct * 100)) +   geom_col(fill = colors["native"]) +   coord_flip() +   labs(title = "Native American Students by District",        subtitle = "Top 10 districts by percent Native American (min 50 students)",        x = "", y = "Percent Native American") +   theme_readme()

title: Minnesota Enrollment Trends
text: Anoka-Hennepin serves 37,000 students across 42 schools, making far Minnesota’s largest district. remained relatively stable urban districts declined, absorbing families Minneapolis.
code: ah <- enr %>%   filter(is_district, grepl("Anoka-Hennepin", district_name, ignore.case = TRUE),          subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL")  ggplot(ah, aes(x = end_year, y = n_students)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1.5, color = colors["total"]) +   geom_point(size = 3, color = colors["total"]) +   scale_y_continuous(labels = comma, limits = c(0, NA)) +   labs(title = "Anoka-Hennepin: Minnesota's Largest District",        subtitle = "Over 37,000 students across 42 schools",        x = "School Year", y = "Students") +   theme_readme()

title: Minnesota Enrollment Trends
text: Small rural districts across Minnesota continue consolidate share services enrollment declines. Many districts now fewer 500 students, making difficult offer comprehensive programming.
code: small_districts <- enr_current %>%   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   mutate(size_category = case_when(     n_students < 250 ~ "Under 250",     n_students < 500 ~ "250-500",     n_students < 1000 ~ "500-1,000",     n_students < 5000 ~ "1,000-5,000",     TRUE ~ "5,000+"   )) %>%   group_by(size_category) %>%   summarize(n_districts = n(), .groups = "drop") %>%   mutate(size_category = factor(size_category,                                  levels = c("Under 250", "250-500", "500-1,000",                                            "1,000-5,000", "5,000+")))  ggplot(small_districts, aes(x = size_category, y = n_districts)) +   geom_col(fill = colors["total"]) +   labs(title = "Many Minnesota Districts Are Small",        subtitle = "Distribution of districts by total enrollment",        x = "District Size", y = "Number of Districts") +   theme_readme()

what: 15. Special education rates vary by district
title: Minnesota Enrollment Trends
text: Special education identification rates vary significantly across Minnesota districts, 10% 20%. Larger urban districts tend higher identification rates, reflecting student need assessment capacity.
code: sped <- enr_current %>%   filter(is_district, subgroup == "special_ed", grade_level == "TOTAL",          n_students > 100) %>%   arrange(desc(pct)) %>%   head(15) %>%   mutate(district_label = reorder(district_name, pct))  ggplot(sped, aes(x = district_label, y = pct * 100)) +   geom_col(fill = colors["total"]) +   coord_flip() +   labs(title = "Special Education Rates Vary by District",        subtitle = "Top 15 districts by percent receiving special education services",        x = "", y = "Percent Special Education") +   theme_readme()

title: Getting Started with mnschooldata
text: Install GitHub:
code: # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("almartin82/mnschooldata")

title: Getting Started with mnschooldata
text: Fetch recent year Minnesota enrollment data:
code: library(mnschooldata) library(dplyr)  # Fetch 2024 enrollment data enr <- fetch_enr(2024, use_cache = TRUE)  head(enr) # For vignette building, use cached data to avoid network calls data("enr_2024_example", package = "mnschooldata") enr <- enr_2024_example head(enr) ##   end_year state              district_name                school_name    level ## 1     2024    MN Minneapolis Public Schools Minneapolis Public Schools district ## 2     2024    MN Minneapolis Public Schools Minneapolis Public Schools district ## 3     2024    MN Minneapolis Public Schools Minneapolis Public Schools district ## 4     2024    MN Minneapolis Public Schools Minneapolis Public Schools district ## 5     2024    MN Minneapolis Public Schools Minneapolis Public Schools district ## 6     2024    MN  Saint Paul Public Schools  Saint Paul Public Schools district ##           subgroup grade_level n_students aggregation_flag is_district is_state ## 1 total_enrollment       TOTAL      28500         official        TRUE    FALSE ## 2            white       TOTAL       9500         official        TRUE    FALSE ## 3            black       TOTAL      12500         official        TRUE    FALSE ## 4         hispanic       TOTAL       3200         official        TRUE    FALSE ## 5            asian       TOTAL       2100         official        TRUE    FALSE ## 6 total_enrollment       TOTAL      33200         official        TRUE    FALSE ##       type ## 1 District ## 2 District ## 3 District ## 4 District ## 5 District ## 6 District

title: Getting Started with mnschooldata
text: data returned tidy (long) format default: row one subgroup one school/district/state subgroup identifies demographic group (e.g., “total_enrollment”, “white”, “black”, “hispanic”, “econ_disadv”) grade_level shows grade (“TOTAL”, “K”, “01”, “02”, etc.) n_students enrollment count pct percentage total enrollment
code: enr %>%   filter(is_state) %>%   select(end_year, type, subgroup, grade_level, n_students) %>%   head(10)

title: Getting Started with mnschooldata
text: Use aggregation flags filter data:
code: # State totals state <- enr %>% filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") state %>% select(end_year, n_students)  # All districts districts <- enr %>% filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") nrow(districts)  # All schools schools <- enr %>% filter(is_school, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") nrow(schools)

title: Getting Started with mnschooldata
code: enr %>%   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   arrange(desc(n_students)) %>%   select(district_name, n_students) %>%   head(10)

title: Getting Started with mnschooldata
code: # State demographics enr %>%   filter(is_state, grade_level == "TOTAL",          subgroup %in% c("white", "black", "hispanic", "asian")) %>%   select(subgroup, n_students, pct) %>%   mutate(pct = round(pct * 100, 1))

title: Getting Started with mnschooldata
text: prefer wide format (one column per demographic), set tidy = FALSE:
code: enr_wide <- fetch_enr(2024, tidy = FALSE, use_cache = TRUE)  enr_wide %>%   filter(type == "State") %>%   select(end_year, row_total, white, black, hispanic, asian, econ_disadv)

title: Getting Started with mnschooldata
text: Fetch multiple years analyze trends:
code: # Fetch 5 years of data enr_multi <- fetch_enr_multi(2020:2024, use_cache = TRUE)  # State enrollment trend enr_multi %>%   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   select(end_year, n_students)

title: Getting Started with mnschooldata
text: Minnesota several unique district types:
code: enr %>%   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   mutate(district_type = case_when(     grepl("^01", district_id) ~ "Independent School District",     grepl("^03", district_id) ~ "Special School District (e.g., Minneapolis, St. Paul)",     grepl("^06", district_id) ~ "Intermediate School District",     grepl("^07", district_id) ~ "Charter School",     TRUE ~ "Other"   )) %>%   count(district_type) %>%   arrange(desc(n))

title: Getting Started with mnschooldata
text: See vignette("enrollment-trends") 15 stories Minnesota enrollment data Use ?fetch_enr full function documentation

title: Authors and Citation
text: Al Martin. Author, maintainer.

code: @Manual{,   title = {mnschooldata: Minnesota School Data},   author = {Al Martin},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://almartin82.github.io/mnschooldata}, }

title: Minnesota School Data
text: Documentation | Getting Started | Enrollment Trends Fetch analyze Minnesota school enrollment data Minnesota Department Education (MDE) R Python.

what: What can you find with mnschooldata?
title: Minnesota School Data
text: 18 years enrollment data (2007-2024). 870,000 students. 330+ districts. fifteen stories hiding numbers:

previous_headings: What can you find with mnschooldata?
what: 1. Minneapolis and St. Paul are shrinking
title: Minnesota School Data
text: Twin Cities’ two largest urban districts lost 10,000 students past decade, driven declining birth rates, rising housing costs, competition charters suburbs.
code: library(mnschooldata) library(dplyr)  enr <- fetch_enr_multi(2015:2024)  enr %>%   filter(is_district, grepl("Minneapolis|St. Paul", district_name),          subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   select(end_year, district_name, n_students)

previous_headings: What can you find with mnschooldata?
title: Minnesota School Data
text: Minneapolis one largest Somali populations United States, fundamentally changing city’s schools two decades. Black students now make approximately 35% Minneapolis enrollment.
code: enr %>%   filter(is_district, grepl("Minneapolis", district_name),          !grepl("Special", district_name),          grade_level == "TOTAL",          subgroup %in% c("white", "black", "hispanic", "asian")) %>%   mutate(pct = round(pct * 100, 1)) %>%   select(end_year, subgroup, pct)

previous_headings: What can you find with mnschooldata?
title: Minnesota School Data
text: Minnesota invented charter schools 1991 - first state . Today, 180 charter schools serve nearly 7% state’s students.
code: # Charter schools have district IDs starting with "07" enr %>%   filter(is_district, grepl("^07", district_id),          subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   group_by(end_year) %>%   summarize(total_charter = sum(n_students, na.rm = TRUE),             n_charters = n_distinct(district_id))

previous_headings: What can you find with mnschooldata?
title: Minnesota School Data
text: Minneapolis St. Paul shrink, suburban ring continues grow. Districts like Anoka-Hennepin (state’s largest), Lakeville, Rosemount-Apple Valley-Eagan absorbed families leaving urban core.
code: enr %>%   filter(is_district,          grepl("Anoka-Hennepin|Lakeville|Rosemount|Prior Lake", district_name),          subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   select(end_year, district_name, n_students)

previous_headings: What can you find with mnschooldata?
title: Minnesota School Data
text: 85% white 2007 70% today, Minnesota experiencing one fastest demographic shifts Midwest.
code: enr %>%   filter(is_state, grade_level == "TOTAL",          subgroup %in% c("white", "black", "hispanic", "asian")) %>%   mutate(pct = round(pct * 100, 1)) %>%   select(end_year, subgroup, pct)

previous_headings: What can you find with mnschooldata?
title: Minnesota School Data
text: pandemic caused 8% drop Minnesota kindergarten enrollment 2021 - nearly 5,000 fewer children.
code: enr %>%   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment",          grade_level %in% c("K", "01", "06", "12")) %>%   select(end_year, grade_level, n_students)

previous_headings: What can you find with mnschooldata?
title: Minnesota School Data
text: Minnesota’s Iron Range - mining region northeast - continues decades-long population decline. Districts like Hibbing, Virginia, Eveleth-Gilbert lost students mining employment decreases.
code: enr %>%   filter(is_district,          grepl("Hibbing|Virginia|Eveleth|Chisholm|Mountain Iron", district_name),          subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   group_by(end_year) %>%   summarize(total = sum(n_students, na.rm = TRUE))

previous_headings: What can you find with mnschooldata?
title: Minnesota School Data
text: Driven Mayo Clinic $5 billion expansion (Destination Medical Center), Rochester one outstate cities gaining students.
code: enr %>%   filter(is_district, grepl("Rochester", district_name),          subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   select(end_year, district_name, n_students)

previous_headings: What can you find with mnschooldata?
title: Minnesota School Data
text: 80,000 Minnesota students English learners, concentrated heavily Twin Cities metro.
code: enr_2024 <- fetch_enr(2024)  enr_2024 %>%   filter(is_district, subgroup == "lep", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   arrange(desc(n_students)) %>%   select(district_name, n_students, pct) %>%   head(10)

previous_headings: What can you find with mnschooldata?
title: Minnesota School Data
text: Minnesota’s economic inequality stark: 5% free/reduced lunch wealthy districts like Edina 70% urban rural districts.
code: enr_2024 %>%   filter(is_district, subgroup == "econ_disadv", grade_level == "TOTAL",          n_students > 500) %>%   arrange(desc(pct)) %>%   mutate(pct = round(pct * 100, 1)) %>%   select(district_name, n_students, pct) %>%   head(10)

previous_headings: What can you find with mnschooldata?
what: 11. Duluth: Slow decline in the Northland
title: Minnesota School Data
text: Minnesota’s fourth-largest city seen steady enrollment decline regional economy struggled.
code: enr %>%   filter(is_district, grepl("Duluth", district_name),          subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   select(end_year, district_name, n_students)

previous_headings: What can you find with mnschooldata?
what: 12. Native American students: concentrated in specific regions
title: Minnesota School Data
text: Minnesota significant Native American student populations, concentrated districts near reservations including Red Lake, Cass Lake-Bena, Fond du Lac.
code: enr_2024 %>%   filter(is_district, subgroup == "native_american", grade_level == "TOTAL",          n_students >= 50) %>%   arrange(desc(pct)) %>%   mutate(pct = round(pct * 100, 1)) %>%   select(district_name, n_students, pct) %>%   head(10)

title: Minnesota School Data
text: Small rural districts across Minnesota continue consolidate share services enrollment declines. Many districts now fewer 500 students.
code: enr_2024 %>%   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   mutate(size_category = case_when(     n_students < 250 ~ "Under 250",     n_students < 500 ~ "250-500",     n_students < 1000 ~ "500-1,000",     n_students < 5000 ~ "1,000-5,000",     TRUE ~ "5,000+"   )) %>%   group_by(size_category) %>%   summarize(n_districts = n())

what: 15. Special education rates vary by district
title: Minnesota School Data
text: Special education identification rates vary significantly across Minnesota districts, 10% 20%.
code: enr_2024 %>%   filter(is_district, subgroup == "special_ed", grade_level == "TOTAL",          n_students > 100) %>%   arrange(desc(pct)) %>%   mutate(pct = round(pct * 100, 1)) %>%   select(district_name, n_students, pct) %>%   head(15)

title: Minnesota School Data
code: # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("almartin82/mnschooldata")

title: Minnesota School Data
code: library(mnschooldata) library(dplyr)  # Fetch one year enr_2024 <- fetch_enr(2024)  # Fetch multiple years enr_multi <- fetch_enr_multi(2020:2024)  # State totals enr_2024 %>%   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL")  # Largest districts enr_2024 %>%   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   arrange(desc(n_students)) %>%   head(15)  # Minneapolis demographics enr_2024 %>%   filter(grepl("Minneapolis", district_name), grade_level == "TOTAL",          subgroup %in% c("white", "black", "hispanic", "asian")) %>%   select(subgroup, n_students, pct)

title: Minnesota School Data
code: import pymnschooldata as mn  # Check available years years = mn.get_available_years() print(f"Data available from {years['min_year']} to {years['max_year']}")  # Fetch one year enr_2024 = mn.fetch_enr(2024)  # Fetch multiple years enr_multi = mn.fetch_enr_multi([2020, 2021, 2022, 2023, 2024])  # State totals state_total = enr_2024[     (enr_2024['is_state'] == True) &     (enr_2024['subgroup'] == 'total_enrollment') &     (enr_2024['grade_level'] == 'TOTAL') ]  # Largest districts districts = enr_2024[     (enr_2024['is_district'] == True) &     (enr_2024['subgroup'] == 'total_enrollment') &     (enr_2024['grade_level'] == 'TOTAL') ].sort_values('n_students', ascending=False).head(15)

title: Minnesota School Data
text: Data sourced Minnesota Department Education: - MDEAnalytics Portal: https://pub.education.mn.gov/MDEAnalytics/Data.jsp - MDE Data Center: https://education.mn.gov/MDE/Data/

title: Minnesota School Data
text: Levels: State, District (~330), School (~2,200) Demographics: White, Black, Hispanic, Asian, Native American, Pacific Islander, Multiracial Special populations: Economically disadvantaged, English learners, Special education, Homeless Grade levels: PK 12

title: Minnesota School Data
text: 01: Independent School Districts (districts) 02: Common School Districts 03: Special School Districts (Minneapolis, St. Paul, Duluth) 06: Intermediate School Districts (IEICs) 07: Charter Schools (~180 charters) MARSS: Minnesota Automated Reporting Student System October 1 counts: enrollment data represents October 1 official counts Suppression: Small cell sizes may suppressed privacy

what: Part of the State Schooldata Project
title: Minnesota School Data
text: simple, consistent interface accessing state-published school data Python R. 50 state packages: github.com/almartin82

text: Removes cached data files.

text: end_year Optional school year clear. NULL, clears years. type Optional data type clear. NULL, clears types.

title: Clear the mnschooldata cache — clear_cache
text: Invisibly returns number files removed

title: Clear the mnschooldata cache — clear_cache
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Clear all cached data clear_cache()  # Clear only 2024 data clear_cache(2024)  # Clear only tidy format data clear_cache(type = "tidy") } # }

title: Fetch Minnesota enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: Downloads processes enrollment data Minnesota Department Education's MDEAnalytics portal. Data comes MARSS (Minnesota Automated Reporting Student System) represents October 1 enrollment counts.

title: Fetch Minnesota enrollment data — fetch_enr
code: fetch_enr(end_year, tidy = TRUE, use_cache = TRUE)

title: Fetch Minnesota enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: end_year school year end. Year end academic year - e.g., 2023-24 school year year '2024'. Valid values 2007-2024. tidy TRUE (default), returns data long (tidy) format subgroup column. FALSE, returns wide format. use_cache TRUE (default), uses locally cached data available. Set FALSE force re-download MDE.

title: Fetch Minnesota enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: Data frame enrollment data. Wide format includes columns district_id, campus_id, names, enrollment counts demographic/grade. Tidy format pivots counts subgroup grade_level columns.

title: Fetch Minnesota enrollment data — fetch_enr
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get 2024 enrollment data (2023-24 school year) enr_2024 <- fetch_enr(2024)  # Get wide format enr_wide <- fetch_enr(2024, tidy = FALSE)  # Force fresh download (ignore cache) enr_fresh <- fetch_enr(2024, use_cache = FALSE)  # Filter to specific district (Minneapolis) mpls <- enr_2024 |>   dplyr::filter(grepl("Minneapolis", district_name, ignore.case = TRUE)) } # }

what: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
title: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
text: Downloads combines enrollment data multiple school years.

title: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
code: fetch_enr_multi(end_years, tidy = TRUE, use_cache = TRUE)

title: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
text: end_years Vector school year ends (e.g., c(2022, 2023, 2024)) tidy TRUE (default), returns data long (tidy) format. use_cache TRUE (default), uses locally cached data available.

title: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
text: Combined data frame enrollment data requested years

title: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get 3 years of data enr_multi <- fetch_enr_multi(2022:2024)  # Track enrollment trends enr_multi |>   dplyr::filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   dplyr::select(end_year, n_students) } # }

title: mnschooldata: Minnesota School Data — mnschooldata-package
text: simple, consistent interface accessing Minnesota school data Python R. Downloads processes school enrollment data Minnesota Department Education (MDE). Provides functions fetching data MARSS (Minnesota Automated Reporting Student System) transforming tidy format analysis.

title: mnschooldata: Minnesota School Data — mnschooldata-package
text: fetch_enr Download enrollment data single year fetch_enr_multi Download enrollment data multiple years tidy_enr Convert wide format tidy long format get_available_years List available data years

title: mnschooldata: Minnesota School Data — mnschooldata-package
text: Data comes Minnesota Department Education's MDEAnalytics portal. Enrollment counts based October 1 enrollment reported via MARSS (Minnesota Automated Reporting Student System). Available data: Years: 2007-2024 Levels: State, District, School (Campus) Demographics: Race/ethnicity, gender, special populations Grades: Pre-K 12

title: mnschooldata: Minnesota School Data — mnschooldata-package
text: Minnesota uses district type + number system: District Type: 2-digit code (01=Independent, 02=Common, 03=Special, 06=IEIC, 07=Charter) District Number: 4-digit number School Number: Additional digits schools within districts

title: mnschooldata: Minnesota School Data — mnschooldata-package
text: Maintainer: Al Martin almartin@example.com
